introduction: In certain developed countries around the world, there is a stark difference in the availability of

vocabulary.definition: a method of connecting to the internet using a standard telephone line
vocabulary.example: I remember the days of dial-up internet when it took forever to load a webpage.

vocabulary.definition: occurring irregularly or intermittently; stopping and starting unpredictably
vocabulary.example: Her internet connection is very spasmodic, sometimes working fine and other times not at all.

vocabulary.definition: unreliable or of poor quality; not trustworthy
vocabulary.example: The dodgy internet cables in the area cause frequent connection issues for residents.

vocabulary.definition: information passed verbally from one person to another
vocabulary.example: The news about the event spread quickly through word-of-mouth.

vocabulary.definition: a small electronic device with a particular function
vocabulary.example: He always carries around the latest gadgets to stay connected on the go.

vocabulary.definition: related to computers, technology, and the internet
vocabulary.example: The cyber attack caused a major disruption to the company's online services.
